title: Squeeze
description: Squeeze - A pre-flop reraise where player A bets, player B calls, and you make a big squeeze to squeeze both opponents out and take the pot immediately.

title: vs Open
description: A situation where one opponent raised to you and you need to make one of three decisions: fold; 3bet or call.

title: vs 3Bet
description: The situation when you raised and the player re-raised behind you.

title: BB defense
description: The situation when you are in the big blind and one of the players raises.

title: Open Push
description: Push is a slang expression for the action of a player who goes all-in and “pushes” (push) his stack into the center of the table.

title: BvB
description: The situation when only the small and big blind remained in the game preflop.

title: RFI
description: The abbreviation RFI stands for “raise first in” and describes the situation when a player raises preflop, becoming the first person to voluntarily invest money in the pot.
